definition: thin piece/flake/a slice/film/TV play/to slice/to carve thin/partial/incomplete/one-sided/classifier for slices, tablets, tract of land, area of water/classifier for CDs, movies, DVDs etc/used with numeral 一[yi1]: classifier for scenario, scene, feeling, atmosphere, sound etc/Kangxi radical 91
erhua variant of 恐怖片[kong3 bu4 pian4]

sentences.english: A small piece of pottery under a rock might be a clue to the past.
sentences.chinese: 岩石下面的一小片兒瓷器可能就是研究過去的線索。

sentences.english: Frank, how about some bacon with your French toast ?
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭克，弄點兒鹹肉就着煎麪包片兒喫好不好？

sentences.english: Love is cleaning the pieces of ice off his raincoat.
sentences.chinese: 愛是清掉他雨衣上的冰片兒。

sentences.english: I tell her that I want two pieces.
And she broke it in little pieces, now how do you do?
sentences.chinese: 然後被她碎成小片兒，現在感覺如何？

sentences.english: An egg-white spinach omelet with sliced avocado and some whole-grain toast will do the trick!
sentences.chinese: 蛋白菠菜蛋卷外加鱷梨片兒和全麥土司最好了。

sentences.english: Is it me, or is he just lost in that area?
sentences.chinese: 我怎麼覺得他是在那片兒地區迷路了呢。

sentences.english: They're waiting in line to buy tickets for the new movie.
sentences.chinese: 他們在排隊等待買看新影片兒的票。

sentences.english: When the lid came off the box, loose papers drifted out.
sentences.chinese: 箱子蓋掉了，紙片兒撒了出來。

sentences.english: This hotpot shop uses superior quality sliced beef from the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region.
sentences.chinese: 火鍋店選用的都是內蒙古的上等羊肉片兒。
